page.title: 14Schools' Chess in Skegness
page.content: One of the most important extra activities in our school is the School Chess Club. There are more than 100 members who take part in many competitions. The School Chess Teams have been very successful in recent years, and 1984's captain, Richard Birks, played for England. This year the Under 11 Team's members have all played for Lincolnshire. Two of them are County Champions. Tamsin Hoffman is the County Girls' Under 11 Champion and Michelle Barker is the County Under 10 Champion. She has written about playing chess : When I am playing chess I am very nervous. I have to put my hands under the table because they are trembling. When I can see checkmate my heart starts going fast because I am excited.When I win a trophy I am very pleased but nervous when I collect it.
